blocks.name: clim1fr1
blocks.content: A class of sequences of fractions that converge to 1. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)

thm clim1fr1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, nat1))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c1, nat0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cc))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl6breq(c0, cli, nat1, co(nat1, caddc, nat0), w0)
  climadd(hs0, c0, nat1, nat0, cn, nat1, cmpt(s0, cn, nat1), universe, cmpt(s0, cn, co(c2, cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(s0)))), w0)
  climconst(hs0, cmpt(s0, cn, nat1), nat1, cn, nat1, universe, w0)
  nnuz()
  1zzd(w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cn, nat1), universe))
  mptex(s0, cn, nat1)
  1cnd(w0)
  a1i(w0, wcel(c0, universe))

  mptex(s0, cn, co(co(co(c1, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, c2), cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(s0))))
  nnex()
  eqbrtrrd(cmpt(s0, cn, co(c2, cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(s0)))), cli, nat0, cmpt(s0, cn, co(co(c2, cdiv, c1), cdiv, cv(s0))), w0)
  mpteq2dva(s0, cn, co(co(c2, cdiv, c1), cdiv, cv(s0)), co(c2, cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(s0))), w0)

  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cn), wne(cv(s0), nat0))
  nnne0(cv(s0))
  3eqtrd(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), co(cfv(cmpt(s0, cn, nat1), cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(cmpt(s0, cn, co(c2, cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(s0)))), cv(hs0))), co(co(co(c1, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, c2), cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(hs0))), co(nat1, caddc, co(c2, cdiv, co(c1, cmul, cv(hs0)))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))

  dividd(co(c1, cmul, cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))

  eqcomd(nat1, cfv(cmpt(s0, cn, nat1), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))

blocks.name: isumneg
blocks.content: Negation of a converging sum. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm isumneg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, c0, cneg(c1)), cneg(csu(s0, c0, c1))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(csu(s0, c0, c1), cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cseq(c2, caddc, c3), cdm(cli)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  3eqtr2d(csu(s0, c0, cneg(c1)), cneg(csu(s0, c0, c1)), csu(s0, c0, co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1)), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, csu(s0, c0, c1)), w0)
  sumeq2dv(s0, c0, cneg(c1), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1), w0)
  eqcomd(cneg(c1), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c1), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  mulm1d(c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  isummulc2(s0, cneg(nat1), c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  negcld(nat1, w0)
  1cnd(w0)
  mulm1d(csu(s0, c0, c1), w0)
  diff.cneg.s(s0, nat1)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
}

blocks.content: A version of ~ climmul using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)

thm climmulf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cuz, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c3, cli, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c4, cli, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), co(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(c4, cv(s0)))))

blocks.name: climinf
blocks.content: A bounded monotonic nonincreasing sequence converges to the infimum of its range. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: climsuselem1
blocks.content: The subsequence index ` I ` has the expected properties: it belongs to the same upper integers as the original index, and it is always greater than or equal to the original index. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:

thm climdivf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

} = {

  eldifsni(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cc, nat0)

blocks.name: climreeq
blocks.content: If ` F ` is a real function, then ` F ` converges to ` A ` with respect to the standard topology on the reals if and only if it converges to ` A ` with respect to the standard topology on complex numbers. In the theorem, ` R ` is defined to be convergence w.r.t. the standard topology on the reals and then ` F R A ` represents the statement " ` F ` converges to ` A ` , with respect to the standard topology on the reals". Notice that there is no need for the hypothesis that ` A ` is a real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 2-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: climaddf
blocks.content: A version of ~ climadd using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm climaddf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cli, co(c1, caddc, c2)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c3)
  -| wnfc(s0, c4)
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cuz, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c3, cli, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c4, cli, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cc))

  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  climadd(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c5, c6, c3, c7, c4, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cc)), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cc)))

  nfel1(s0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cc)

  eleq1d(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cc, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))

  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wcel(cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), cc))

  eleq1d(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cc, cfv(c4, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(c4, cv(hs0))))), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), co(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), caddc, cfv(c4, cv(s0))))))
  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(c4, cv(hs0)))))

thm climaddf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  โข (w0 โ c0[~~>](c1[+]c2))
  โฃ F/(s0, w0)
  โฃ F/(s0, c3)
  โฃ F/(s0, c4)
  โฃ F/(s0, c0)
  โฃ c5 =(โคโฅ ` c6)
  โฃ (w0 โ c6 โ โค)
  โฃ (w0 โ c3[~~>]c1)
  โฃ (w0 โ c0 โ c7)
  โฃ (w0 โ c4[~~>]c2)
  โฃ ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c3 ` s0)โ โ)
  โฃ ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c4 ` s0)โ โ)
  โฃ ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c0 ` s0)=((c3 ` s0)[+](c4 ` s0)))
  โฃ d(s0, c5)
} = {
  climadd(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c5, c6, c3, c7, c4, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, ((w0 โง hs0 โ c5)โ(c3 ` hs0)โ โ), ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c3 ` s0)โ โ))
  nfim(s0, (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c3 ` hs0)โ โ)
  nfel1(s0, (c3 ` hs0), cc)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs0, (w0 โง s0 โ c5), (c3 ` s0)โ โ, (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c3 ` hs0)โ โ)
  eleq1d((c3 ` s0), cc, (c3 ` hs0), s0 = hs0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, ((w0 โง hs0 โ c5)โ(c4 ` hs0)โ โ), ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c4 ` s0)โ โ))
  nfim(s0, (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c4 ` hs0)โ โ)
  nfel1(s0, (c4 ` hs0), cc)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs0, (w0 โง s0 โ c5), (c4 ` s0)โ โ, (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c4 ` hs0)โ โ)
  eleq1d((c4 ` s0), cc, (c4 ` hs0), s0 = hs0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, ((w0 โง hs0 โ c5)โ(c0 ` hs0)=((c3 ` hs0)[+](c4 ` hs0))), ((w0 โง s0 โ c5)โ(c0 ` s0)=((c3 ` s0)[+](c4 ` s0))))
  nfim(s0, (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c0 ` hs0)=((c3 ` hs0)[+](c4 ` hs0)))
  nfan(s0, w0, hs0 โ c5)
  nfv(s0, hs0 โ c5)
  nfeq(s0, (c0 ` hs0), ((c3 ` hs0)[+](c4 ` hs0)))

  nfcv(s0, hs0)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs0, (w0 โง s0 โ c5), (c0 ` s0)=((c3 ` s0)[+](c4 ` s0)), (w0 โง hs0 โ c5), (c0 ` hs0)=((c3 ` hs0)[+](c4 ` hs0)))
  anbi2d(s0 = hs0, w0, s0 โ c5, hs0 โ c5)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c5)
  eqeq12d((c0 ` s0), ((c3 ` s0)[+](c4 ` s0)), (c0 ` hs0), ((c3 ` hs0)[+](c4 ` hs0)), s0 = hs0)
  fveq2(s0, hs0, c0)

blocks.name: ellimcabssub0
blocks.content: An equivalent condition for being a limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm ellimcabssub0(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, climc, c2)), wcel(nat0, co(c3, climc, c2))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c4, c5))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c4, co(c5, cmin, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c4)), wcel(c5, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4d(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, climc, c2)), wcel(nat0, co(c3, climc, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c4, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2))))))), wa(wcel(nat0, cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c4, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cmin, nat0)), clt, cv(hs2))))))))
  anbi12d(w0, wcel(c0, cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c4, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2)))))), wcel(nat0, cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c4, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cmin, nat0)), clt, cv(hs2)))))))
  2thd(w0, wcel(c0, cc), wcel(nat0, cc))

blocks.name: limccog
blocks.content: Limit of the composition of two functions. If the limit of ` F ` at ` A ` is ` B ` and the limit of ` G ` at ` B ` is ` C ` , then the limit of ` G o. F ` at ` A ` is ` C ` . With respect to ~ limcco and ~ limccnp , here we drop continuity assumptions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: limciccioolb
blocks.content: The limit of a function at the lower bound of a closed interval only depends on the values in the inner open interval. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

} = {
  limcres(c0, co(c1, cioo, c2), c1, co(c1, cicc, c2), cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, cun(co(c1, cicc, c2), csn(c1))), w0)

blocks.name: climf
blocks.content: Express the predicate: The limit of complex number sequence ` F ` is ` A ` , or ` F ` converges to ` A ` . Similar to ~ clim , but without the disjoint var constraint ` F k ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mullimcf
blocks.content: Limit of the multiplication of two functions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mullimcf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), co(c2, climc, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c4, c5, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c6, c5, cc))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c5, co(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cmul, cfv(c6, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c4, climc, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c6, climc, c3)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), co(c2, climc, c3))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), co(c2, climc, c3))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), co(c2, climc, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c5, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c3), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c3)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cmin, co(c0, cmul, c1))), clt, cv(hs2)))))))
  mulcld(c0, c1, w0)

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, climc, c2)), wcel(c0, cc), wral(hs2, crp, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c3, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2)))))))
  ralrimiva(hs2, crp, w0, wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c3, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2))))))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs2), crp)), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, c3, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2))))), wcel(nat1, crp), wral(hs0, c3, wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, c2)), clt, nat1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cmin, c0)), clt, cv(hs2)))))

blocks.name: rexlim2d
blocks.content: Inference removing two restricted quantifiers. Same as ~ rexlimdvv , but with bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable restrictions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm rexlim2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wrex(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w1)), w2))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wi(w1, w2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
} = {
  rexlimd(s0, c0, w0, wrex(s1, c1, w1), w2)
  nfv(s0, w2)
  ex(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wrex(s1, c1, w1), w2))
  rexlimd(s1, c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), w1, w2)
  nfan(s1, w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  nfv(s1, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  nfv(s1, w2)
  expdimp(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wi(w1, w2))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

thm rexlim2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  โข (w0 โ(โ(s0 โ c0, โ(s1 โ c1, w1))โ w2))
  โฃ F/(s0, w0)
  โฃ F/(s1, w0)
  โฃ (w0 โ((s0 โ c0 โง s1 โ c1)โ(w1 โ w2)))
  โฃ d(s0, s1)
  โฃ d(s1, c0)
  โฃ d(s0, w2)
  โฃ d(s1, w2)
} = {
  rexlimd(s0, c0, w0, โ(s1 โ c1, w1), w2)
  nfv(s0, w2)
  ex(w0, s0 โ c0, (โ(s1 โ c1, w1)โ w2))
  rexlimd(s1, c1, (w0 โง s0 โ c0), w1, w2)
  nfan(s1, w0, s0 โ c0)
  nfv(s1, s0 โ c0)
  nfv(s1, w2)
  expdimp(w0, s0 โ c0, s1 โ c1, (w1 โ w2))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: limcrecl
blocks.content: If ` F ` is a real-valued function, ` B ` is a limit point of its domain, and the limit of ` F ` at ` B ` exists, then this limit is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: sumnnodd
blocks.content: A series indexed by ` NN ` with only odd terms. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm sumnnodd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {

blocks.content: The upper bound of an open interval is a limit point of the interval. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

}

blocks.origin:
thm ltmod(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {

blocks.name: lptre2pt
blocks.content: If a set in the real line has a limit point than it contains two distinct points that are closer than a given distance. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsupre
blocks.content: If a sequence is bounded, then the limsup is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.) (Revised by AV, 13-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: limcresiooub
blocks.content: The left limit doesn't change if the function is restricted to a smaller open interval. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limcresioolb
blocks.content: The right limit doesn't change if the function is restricted to a smaller open interval. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: limcleqr
blocks.content: If the left and the right limits are equal, the limit of the function exits and the three limits coincide. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: 0ellimcdiv
blocks.content: If the numerator converges to 0 and the denominator converges to a nonzero number, then the fraction converges to 0. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: clim2cf
blocks.content: Express the predicate ` F ` converges to ` A ` . Similar to ~ clim2 , but without the disjoint var constraint ` F k ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

thm clim2cf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wnfc(s2, c0)
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c2)), wcel(c3, cc))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4rd(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))))
  biantrurd(w0, wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))), wcel(c1, cc))
  ralbidv(s0, crp, w0, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))), wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))
  rexbidva(s1, c2, w0, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))
  ralbidva(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))
  anassrs(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))
  sylan2(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, cv(s1)))), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c3, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))), wcel(cv(s2), c2))
  uztrn2(cv(s1), c2, cv(s2), c4)
  biantrurd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c2)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c3, cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)), wcel(c3, cc))
  clim2f(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  diff.wa.s(s2, w0, wcel(cv(s1), c2))
  diff.wcel.s(s2, cv(s1), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
}

  โข (w0 โ(c0[~~>]c1 โ โ(s0 โ โ+, โ(s1 โ c2, โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)))))

  biantrurd(w0, โ(s0 โ โ+, โ(s1 โ c2, โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)))), c1 โ โ)
  ralbidv(s0, crp, w0, โ(s1 โ c2, โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)), โ(s1 โ c2, โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0))))
  rexbidva(s1, c2, w0, โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0), โ(s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1),(c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)))
  ralbidva(s2, (โคโฅ ` s1), (w0 โง s1 โ c2), (abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0, (c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0))
  anassrs(w0, s1 โ c2, s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1), ((abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0 โ(c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)))
  sylan2(w0, (s1 โ c2 โง s2 โ(โคโฅ ` s1)), ((abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0 โ(c3 โ โ โง(abs `(c3[-]c1))[<]s0)), s2 โ c2)

blocks.name: limclner

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, co(cres(c0, co(c1, cioo, cpnf)), climc, c1)))

blocks.name: limclr
blocks.content: For a limit point, both from the left and from the right, of the domain, the limit of the function exits only if the left and the right limits are equal. In this case, the three limits coincide. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)

  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c5))
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c2, cli, c1), wbr(cres(c2, cfv(cuz, c6)), cli, c1))
  breq1d(c0, cli, c1, cres(c2, cfv(cuz, c6)), w0)
  3eqtrrd(c0, cres(c2, cfv(cuz, c6)), cres(cmpt(s0, c3, c5), cfv(cuz, c6)), cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c5), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cres(c2, cfv(cuz, c6)), cres(cmpt(s0, c3, c5), cfv(cuz, c6))))
  reseq1i(c2, cfv(cuz, c6), cmpt(s0, c3, c5))
  syl(w0, wceq(cres(cmpt(s0, c3, c5), cfv(cuz, c6)), cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c5)), wss(cfv(cuz, c6), c3))
  syl6sseqr(cfv(cuz, c6), c3, cfv(cuz, c4), w0)
  syl(w0, wss(cfv(cuz, c6), cfv(cuz, c4)), wcel(c6, cfv(cuz, c4)))
  uzss(c6, c4)
  resmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c3, c5)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c5), c0))
  eqcomi(cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, c6), c5), c0)
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wbr(cres(c2, cfv(cuz, c6)), cli, c1), wbr(c2, cli, c1)), wcel(c6, cz), wcel(c2, universe))
  syl(w0, wcel(c6, cz), wcel(c6, cfv(cuz, c4)))

  eluzelz(c6, c4)

  fvexi(c3, cuz, c4)

  diff.cuz.s(s0)
}

thm climsubmpt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, co(c1, cmin, c2)), cli, co(c3, cmin, c4)))

  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(hs0)), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), cc))
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), cc)), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc)))
  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), cc))
  nfel1(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), cc)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), cc))
  eleq1d(c1, cc, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))

  fvmptf(s0, cv(hs0), c0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), cc, cmpt(s0, c0, c2), c2)

  diff.cc.s(s0)

blocks.name: climeldmeqmpt

thm climeldmeqmpt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cuz, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(c3, c9))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wceq(c1, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c9)
} = {
  climeldmeq(hs0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cmpt(s0, c2, c3), c5, c4, universe, universe, w0)
  mptexd(s0, c0, c1, c6, w0)

  3eqtr4d(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cmpt(s0, c2, c3), cv(hs0)), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)))
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wceq(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3))), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c5)), wceq(c1, c3)))
  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5)), wceq(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3)))

  nfv(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), c5))

blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

thm climd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3)))))
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wnfc(s1, c4)
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c4, cli, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s1)), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, crp))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3)))), wcel(c3, crp), wral(hs0, crp, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0)))))))
  simprd(w0, wral(hs0, crp, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0)))))), wcel(c2, cc))
  mpbid(w0, wa(wcel(c2, cc), wral(hs0, crp, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0))))))), wbr(c4, cli, c2))
  clim2f2(hs0, s0, s1, c4, c2, c0, c1, c5, universe, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c4, universe), wbr(c4, cli, c2))
  brrelex1i(c4, cli, c2)
  climrel()
  rspcva(hs0, c3, crp, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0))))), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3)))))
  rexralbidv(s0, s1, c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3)))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, cv(hs0)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c3, cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(crp)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmin, c2)), clt, c3)))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c3)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  syl(w0, c4 โ ๐, c4[~~>]c2)
  brrelex1i(c4, cli, c2)
  climrel()
  rspcva(hs0, c3, crp, โ(s0 โ c0, โ(s1 โ(โคโฅ ` s0),(c1 โ โ โง(abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]hs0))), โ(s0 โ c0, โ(s1 โ(โคโฅ ` s0),(c1 โ โ โง(abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]c3))))
  rexralbidv(s0, s1, c0, (โคโฅ ` s0), hs0 = c3, (c1 โ โ โง(abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]hs0), (c1 โ โ โง(abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]c3))
  anbi2d(hs0 = c3, c1 โ โ, (abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]hs0, (abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]c3)
  breq2(hs0, c3, (abs `(c1[-]c2)), clt)

  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(crp)
  diff.hs0.w(โ(s0 โ c0, โ(s1 โ(โคโฅ ` s0),(c1 โ โ โง(abs `(c1[-]c2))[<]c3))))

blocks.name: allbutfifvre
blocks.content: Given a sequence of real-valued functions, and ` X ` that belongs to all but finitely many domains, then its function value is ultimately a real number. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)

thm allbutfifvre(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c4, ciun(s0, c0, ciin(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpd(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cfv(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), c2), cr))), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(c2, cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1)))))))

  syl6eleq(c2, ciun(s0, c0, ciin(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1))))), c4, w0)
  allbutfi(s0, s1, c2, ciun(s0, c0, ciin(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1))))), c0, cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1))), c3)

  syl2anc(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), wi(wcel(c2, cdm(cfv(c1, cv(s1)))), wcel(cfv(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), c2), cr)), w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0))

blocks.name: climfveqf
blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm climfveqf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cli, c0), cfv(cli, c1)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c1)
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  pm2.61dan(w0, wceq(cfv(cli, c0), cfv(cli, c1)), wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wceq(cfv(cli, c0), cfv(cli, c1)), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, c0)), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, c1)))

  sylib(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wbr(c1, cli, cfv(cli, c1)), wcel(c1, cdm(cli)))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wcel(c1, cdm(cli)), wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))
  sylibr(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, c0)))
  adantl(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, c0)))
  biimpi(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wbr(c0, cli, cfv(cli, c0)))
  climdm(c0)
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wb(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c1, cdm(cli))))
  climdm(c1)
  climeq(hs0, c1, cfv(cli, c1), c0, c2, c3, c5, c4, wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c1, c5))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c0, c4))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c3, cz))
  adantlr(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))
  eqcomd(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  climuni(c0, cfv(cli, c0), cfv(cli, c1))
  eqtr4d(cfv(cli, c0), cfv(cli, c1), emptycls, wa(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))))
  adantl(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wceq(cfv(cli, c0), emptycls))
  ndmfv(c0, cli)
  syl(wa(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))), wceq(cfv(cli, c1), emptycls), wn(wcel(c1, cdm(cli))))
  mtbid(wa(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))), wcel(c1, cdm(cli)), wcel(c0, cdm(cli)))
  simpr(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli))))
  adantr(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cdm(cli))), wb(wcel(c0, cdm(cli)), wcel(c1, cdm(cli))))
  climeldmeq(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s0)))))
  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0))))
  nfan(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  nfel1(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  nfeq(s0, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))
  nffv(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  nffv(s0, c1, cv(hs0))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0))))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c2)
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c1)
  ndmfv(c1, cli)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cli, c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(cli))))
}

blocks.name: climmptf
blocks.content: Exhibit a function ` G ` with the same convergence properties as the not-quite-function ` F ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm climmptf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c2, cli, c1)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c5, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wbr(c2, cli, c1)), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c0, c4))
  climmpt(hs0, c3, c0, c4, c1, c2, c5)
  eqtri(c2, cmpt(hs0, c5, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cmpt(s0, c5, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))
  cbvmpt(s0, hs0, c5, cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  nfcv(hs0, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))
  nffv(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0, cv(s0)))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm climfveqmpt3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

blocks.name: limsupbnd1f
blocks.content: If a sequence is eventually at most ` A ` , then the limsup is also at most ` A ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

  imbi12d(s0 = hs0, (w0 โง s0 โ c4), (c0 ` s0)=(c2 ` s0), (w0 โง hs0 โ c4), (c0 ` hs0)=(c2 ` hs0))
  anbi2d(s0 = hs0, w0, s0 โ c4, hs0 โ c4)
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, c4)

}

blocks.name: climfveqmpt2
blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm climfveqmpt2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cli, cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cfv(cli, cmpt(s0, c2, c1))))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c4, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c4)), wcel(c1, c7))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  climfveqf(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cmpt(s0, c2, c1), c4, c3, universe, universe, w0)
  nfmpt1(s0, c0, c1)
  nfmpt1(s0, c2, c1)
  mptexd(s0, c0, c1, c5, w0)
  mptexd(s0, c2, c1, c6, w0)
  eqtr4d(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(s0)), cfv(cmpt(s0, c2, c1), cv(s0)), c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c4)))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c4)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(s0)), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, c7))
  sselda(cv(s0), c4, c0, w0)
  fvmpt2(s0, c0, c1, c7, cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c4)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(s0, c2, c1), cv(s0)), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c1, c7))
  sselda(cv(s0), c4, c2, w0)
  fvmpt2(s0, c2, c1, c7, cmpt(s0, c2, c1))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c2, c1))
}

blocks.name: climeqmpt
blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm climeqmpt(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cli, c2), wbr(cmpt(s0, c3, c1), cli, c2)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cz))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cuz, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c7, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c7, c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)), wcel(c1, c8))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
} = {
  climeqf(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c2, cmpt(s0, c3, c1), c6, c7, universe, universe, w0)
  nfmpt1(s0, c0, c1)
  nfmpt1(s0, c3, c1)
  mptexd(s0, c0, c1, c4, w0)
  mptexd(s0, c3, c1, c5, w0)
  eqtrd(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(s0)), cfv(cmpt(s0, c3, c1), cv(s0)), c1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cv(s0)), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, c8))
  sseldd(cv(s0), c0, c7, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7), wss(c7, c0))
  fvmpt2(s0, c0, c1, c8, cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  eqcomd(c1, cfv(cmpt(s0, c3, c1), cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)))
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)), wceq(cfv(cmpt(s0, c3, c1), cv(s0)), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(c1, c8))
  sseldd(cv(s0), c3, c7, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7), wss(c7, c3))
  simpr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c7))
  fvmpt2(s0, c3, c1, c8, cmpt(s0, c3, c1))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c3, c1))
}

blocks.name: limsuppnfd
blocks.content: If the restriction of a function to every upper interval is unbounded above, its ` limsup ` is ` +oo ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupresuz
blocks.content: If the real part of the domain of a function is a subset of the integers, the superior limit doesn't change when the function is restricted to an upper set of integers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupresuz(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(clsp, cres(c0, c1)), cfv(clsp, c0)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wss(cdm(cres(c0, cr)), cz))
} = {
  3eqtr3d(cfv(clsp, cres(c0, c1)), cfv(clsp, c0), cfv(clsp, cres(cres(c0, c1), cr)), cfv(clsp, cres(c0, cr)), w0)
  eqtrd(cfv(clsp, cres(cres(c0, c1), cr)), cfv(clsp, cres(c0, cr)), cfv(clsp, cres(cres(c0, cr), c1)), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(cfv(clsp, cres(cres(c0, c1), cr)), cfv(clsp, cres(cres(c0, cr), c1))))

  fveq2d(clsp, cres(cres(c0, cr), c1), cres(cres(c0, cr), co(c2, cico, cpnf)), w0)
  3eqtrrd(cres(cres(c0, cr), c1), cres(cres(c0, cr), co(c2, cico, cpnf)), cres(cres(cres(c0, cr), cz), co(c2, cico, cpnf)), cres(cres(c0, cr), cin(cz, co(c2, cico, cpnf))), w0)
  reseq1d(cres(c0, cr), co(c2, cico, cpnf), cres(cres(c0, cr), cz), w0)
  eqcomd(cres(c0, cr), cres(cres(c0, cr), cz), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cres(cres(c0, cr), cz), cres(c0, cr)), wrel(cres(c0, cr)), wss(cdm(cres(c0, cr)), cz))

  a1i(w0, wceq(cres(cres(cres(c0, cr), cz), co(c2, cico, cpnf)), cres(cres(c0, cr), cin(cz, co(c2, cico, cpnf)))))

  reseq2d(cres(c0, cr), cin(cz, co(c2, cico, cpnf)), c1, w0)
  eqcomd(cin(cz, co(c2, cico, cpnf)), c1, w0)
  uzinico(c1, c2, w0)
  limsupresico(cres(c0, cr), co(c2, cico, cpnf), c2, universe, w0)
  zred(c2, w0)
  eqid(co(c2, cico, cpnf))
  resexd(c0, cr, c3, w0)
  limsupresre(cres(c0, c1), universe, w0)

}

blocks.name: climinf2
blocks.content: A convergent, nonincreasing sequence, converges to the infimum of its range. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

  ralbidv(s0, c1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))
  breq1(cv(s1), cv(hs0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))

blocks.name: limsupvaluz
blocks.content: The superior limit, when the domain of the function is a set of upper integers (the first condition is needed, otherwise the l.h.s. would be ` -oo ` and the r.h.s. would be ` +oo ` ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

  3eqtrd(cfv(clsp, c0), cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt))), cxr, clt), cinf(cima(cmpt(hs0, cr, csup(cin(cima(c0, co(cv(hs0), cico, cpnf)), cxr), cxr, clt)), c1), cxr, clt), cinf(crn(cmpt(hs1, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs1)))), cxr, clt))), cxr, clt), w0)

  mptima2(hs0, cr, csup(cin(cima(c0, co(cv(hs0), cico, cpnf)), cxr), cxr, clt), c1, w0)

blocks.name: limsupresuz2
blocks.content: If the domain of a function is a subset of the integers, the superior limit doesn't change when the function is restricted to an upper set of integers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsuppnflem
blocks.content: If the restriction of a function to every upper interval is unbounded above, its ` limsup ` is ` +oo ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsuppnf
blocks.content: If the restriction of a function to every upper interval is unbounded above, its ` limsup ` is ` +oo ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupubuz
blocks.content: For a real-valued function on a set of upper integers, if the superior limit is not ` +oo ` , then the function is bounded above. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: climinf2mpt
blocks.content: A bounded below, monotonic nonincreasing sequence converges to the infimum of its range. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

thm climinf2mpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cli, cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cxr, clt)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wbr(c3, cle, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cli)))

blocks.name: climinfmpt
blocks.content: A bounded below, monotonic nonincreasing sequence converges to the infimum of its range. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm climinfmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cr))

  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wbr(c3, cle, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s2), cle, c1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

blocks.name: limsupvaluzmpt
blocks.content: The superior limit, when the domain of the function is a set of upper integers (the first condition is needed, otherwise the l.h.s. would be ` -oo ` and the r.h.s. would be ` +oo ` ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupvaluzmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(clsp, cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cinf(crn(cmpt(s1, c0, csup(crn(cmpt(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), c1)), cxr, clt))), cxr, clt)))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

blocks.name: limsupmnf
blocks.content: The superior limit of a function is ` -oo ` if and only if every real number is the upper bound of the restriction of the function to an upper interval of real numbers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wnfc(s2, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cxr))

  -| diffss(s0, s2)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

blocks.name: limsupequz
blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same superior limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsupre2lem
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is smaller than the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually larger than the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupre2
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is smaller than the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually larger than the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsupmnfuz
blocks.content: The superior limit of a function is ` -oo ` if and only if every real number is the upper bound of the restriction of the function to a set of upper integers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupre2mpt
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is smaller than the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually larger than the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupre2mpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(cfv(clsp, cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cr), wa(wrex(s1, cr, wral(s2, cr, wrex(s0, c0, wa(wbr(cv(s2), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), clt, c1))))), wrex(s1, cr, wrex(s2, cr, wral(s0, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s2), cle, cv(s0)), wbr(c1, clt, cv(s1)))))))))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)

blocks.name: limsupequzmptf
blocks.content: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another have the same superior limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupre3lem
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupre3lem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(cfv(clsp, c0), cr), wa(wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, cr, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2))))))), wrex(s0, cr, wrex(s1, cr, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wnfc(s2, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

blocks.name: limsupre3
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupre3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(cfv(clsp, c0), cr), wa(wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, cr, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2))))))), wrex(s0, cr, wrex(s1, cr, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wnfc(s2, c0)
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cxr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(cfv(clsp, c0), cr), wa(wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, cr, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cfv(c0, cv(s2))))))), wrex(s0, cr, wrex(s1, cr, wral(s2, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cle, cv(s0))))))), wa(wrex(hs2, cr, wral(hs0, cr, wrex(hs1, c1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs2), cle, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))), wrex(hs2, cr, wrex(hs0, cr, wral(hs1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cle, cv(hs2))))))))

blocks.name: limsupre3mpt
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, at some point, in any upper part of the reals; 2. there is a real number that is eventually greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsupre3uzlem
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, infinitely often; 2. there is a real number that is eventually greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: limsupre3uz
blocks.content: Given a function on the extended reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, infinitely often; 2. there is a real number that is eventually greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupreuz
blocks.content: Given a function on the reals, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, infinitely often; 2. there is a real number that is greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: limsupvaluz2
blocks.content: The superior limit, when the domain of a real-valued function is a set of upper integers, and the superior limit is real. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm limsupvaluz2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(clsp, c0), cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt))), cr, clt)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(clsp, c0), cr))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  3eqtrd(cfv(clsp, c0), cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt))), cr, clt), cinf(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), cxr, clt), cinf(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), cr, clt), w0)
  limsupvaluz(hs0, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wceq(cinf(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), cxr, clt), cinf(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), cr, clt)), wss(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), cr), wne(crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), emptycls), wrex(hs1, cr, wral(hs2, crn(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt))), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cv(hs2)))))
  frnd(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt)), cr, c1, w0)
  fmpttd(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt), cr, w0)
  rnmptn0(hs0, cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt)), c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt), universe, w0)
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, c1, csup(crn(cres(c0, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt)))
  uzn0d(c1, c2, w0)

blocks.name: limsupreuzmpt
blocks.content: Given a function on the reals, defined on a set of upper integers, its supremum limit is real if and only if two condition holds: 1. there is a real number that is less than or equal to the function, infinitely often; 2. there is a real number that is greater than or equal to the function. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: supcnvlimsup
blocks.content: If a function on a set of upper integers has a real superior limit, the supremum of the rightmost parts of the function, converges to that superior limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: supcnvlimsupmpt
blocks.content: If a function on a set of upper integers has a real superior limit, the supremum of the rightmost parts of the function, converges to that superior limit. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 23-Oct-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm supcnvlimsupmpt(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cmpt(s0, c0, csup(crn(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c1)), cxr, clt)), cli, cfv(clsp, cmpt(s1, c0, c1))))
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cfv(clsp, cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), cr))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqbrtrd(cmpt(s0, c0, csup(crn(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c1)), cxr, clt)), cli, cfv(clsp, cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), cmpt(hs0, c0, csup(crn(cres(cmpt(s1, c0, c1), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), cxr, clt)), w0)

  supeq1d(crn(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c1)), cxr, clt, crn(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))

  supeq1d(crn(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c1)), cxr, clt, crn(cres(cmpt(s1, c0, c1), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  rneqd(cmpt(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(hs0)), c1), cres(cmpt(s1, c0, c1), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))

thm climuzlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  impbida(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  jca(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))
  adantl(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(c1, cc))
  climcl(c0, c1)
  mpd(wa(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1)), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  adantl(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  simprd(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))), wcel(c1, cc))
  mpbid(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))), wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  id(wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  clim(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(s2)), universe, wbr(c0, cli, c1))
  brrelex1i(c0, cli, c1)
  climrel()
  eqidd(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), wa(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wcel(cv(s2), cz)))
  adantr(w0, wbr(c0, cli, c1), wi(wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))))
  ralimdva(s0, crp, w0, wrex(s1, cz, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))), wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0)))))

blocks.name: climuz
blocks.content: Express the predicate: The limit of complex number sequence ` F ` is ` A ` , or ` F ` converges to ` A ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 2-Jan-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm climuz(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cli, c1), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wral(s0, crp, wrex(s1, c2, wral(s2, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(c0, cv(s2)), cmin, c1)), clt, cv(s0))))))))
  -| wnfc(s2, c0)

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cuz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, cc))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {

blocks.name: climisp
blocks.content: If a sequence converges to an isolated point (w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers) then the sequence eventually becomes that point. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: climxrrelem
blocks.content: If a seqence ranging over the extended reals converges w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers, then there exists an upper set of the integers over which the function is real-valued. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)

blocks.name: climxrre
blocks.content: If a sequence ranging over the extended reals converges w.r.t. the standard topology on the complex numbers, then there exists an upper set of the integers over which the function is real-valued (the weaker hypothesis ` F e. dom ~~> ` is probably not enough, since in principle we could have ` +oo e. CC ` and ` -oo e. CC ` ). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Feb-2022.)
